poem:
Title: Silent Echoes of Misery

In the shadowed heart of Congo,
a steel-rain weeps. Rwanda's yield.
An aid riddle, tied in knots of sorrow,
bleeds the Earth, a wailing field.
Alarmed, yet distant, UK, US,
Fan the flame, M23's cruel duress.
Murder, rape, displacement keen,
Goma trapped within the scene.
From Rwanda's hand, a perilous dance,
Whilst nations eye, in cold askance.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "It’s time to ask why the US and UK fund Rwanda while atrocities mount up in DRC | Vava Tampa For the third time in 12 months, a UN investigation has expressed concern over Rwanda’s role in arming and training the M23 militia accused of indiscriminate killing, rape and mass displacement in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Yet even as the Mouvement du 23 Mars (M23) encircles Goma – a city of 2 million". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
